verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun sent out of Shittim two men to spy secretly , saying , Go view the land , even Jericho. And they went , and came into an harlot’s house , named Rahab , and lodged there.\f + \fr 2.1 \ft sent: or, had sent\f*\f + \fr 2.1 \ft lodged: Heb. lay\f*
And it was told the king of Jericho , saying , Behold, there came men in hither to night of the children of Israel to search out the country.
And the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab , saying , Bring forth the men that are come to thee, which are entered into thine house : for they be come to search out all the country.
And the woman took the two men , and hid them, and said thus, There came men unto me, but I wist not whence they \add were:\add*

And it came to pass \add about the time\add* of shutting of the gate , when it was dark , that the men went out : whither the men went I wot not: pursue after them quickly ; for ye shall overtake them.
But she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them with the stalks of flax , which she had laid in order upon the roof.
And the men pursued after them the way to Jordan unto the fords : and as soon as they which pursued after them were gone out , they shut the gate. \p
¶ And before they were laid down , she came up unto them upon the roof ;

And she said unto the men , I know that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given you the land , and that your terror is fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land faint because of you.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft faint: Heb. melt\f*

For we have heard how the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* dried up the water of the Red sea for you , when ye came out of Egypt ; and what ye did unto the two kings of the Amorites , that \add were\add* on the other side Jordan , Sihon and Og , whom ye utterly destroyed.

And as soon as we had heard \add these things\add*, our hearts did melt , neither did there remain any more courage in any man , because of you: for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God , he \add is\add* God in heaven above , and in earth beneath.\f + \fr 2.11 \ft did there…: Heb. rose up\f*

Now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, since I have shewed you kindness , that ye will also shew kindness unto my father’s house , and give me a true token :
And \add that\add* ye will save alive my father , and my mother , and my brethren , and my sisters , and all that they have, and deliver our lives from death.

And the men answered her, Our life for yours , if ye utter not this our business. And it shall be, when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given us the land , that we will deal kindly and truly with thee.\f + \fr 2.14 \ft for…: Heb. instead of you to die\f*
Then she let them down by a cord through the window : for her house \add was\add* upon the town wall , and she dwelt upon the wall.
And she said unto them, Get you to the mountain , lest the pursuers meet you; and hide yourselves there three days , until the pursuers be returned : and afterward may ye go your way.
And the men said unto her, We \add will be\add* blameless of this thine oath which thou hast made us swear.

Behold, \add when\add* we come into the land , thou shalt bind this line of scarlet thread in the window which thou didst let us down by : and thou shalt bring thy father , and thy mother , and thy brethren , and all thy father’s household , home unto thee.\f + \fr 2.18 \ft bring: Heb. gather\f*

And it shall be, \add that\add* whosoever shall go out of the doors of thy house into the street , his blood \add shall be\add* upon his head , and we \add will be\add* guiltless : and whosoever shall be with thee in the house , his blood \add shall be\add* on our head , if \add any\add* hand be upon him.
And if thou utter this our business , then we will be quit of thine oath which thou hast made us to swear.
And she said , According unto your words , so \add be\add* it. And she sent them away , and they departed : and she bound the scarlet line in the window. \p

And they went , and came unto the mountain , and abode there three days , until the pursuers were returned : and the pursuers sought \add them\add* throughout all the way , but found \add them\add* not. \p
¶ So the two men returned , and descended from the mountain , and passed over , and came to Joshua the son of Nun , and told him all \add things\add* that befell them:

And they said unto Joshua , Truly the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath delivered into our hands all the land ; for even all the inhabitants of the country do faint because of us.\f + \fr 2.24 \ft faint: Heb. melt\f*
